title: Real-World SOC Analysis & Incident Reporting
motivation: To simulate real-world SOC operations and practice structured security incident response.
details: Completed a 4-day practical SOC analysis exam simulating real-world incidents. Analyzed artifacts, logs, timelines, and attack evidence. Delivered a 62-page report with structured findings, screenshots, and actionable recommendations. Passed from the first try!

title: Critical Security Vulnerabilities Discovery
motivation: To improve the security posture of systems through responsible disclosure.
details: Discovered and reported a critical IDOR vulnerability in the university’s course system that exposed all students’ data; identified a second one that was patched before I had the chance to report it.

title: CTF Participation
motivation: To practice real-world cybersecurity scenarios and sharpen my skills in collaborative environments.
details: Participated in 42CTF (RedTeam Hacker Academy & 42 Abu Dhabi) and Cybersecurity Awareness Day 4.0 CTF (Abu Dhabi University). Focused on exploitation, threat analysis, and security operations in timed, high-pressure settings.

title: Active Directory (AD) Home Labs
motivation: To understand enterprise security and test AD exploitation in a safe environment.
details: Built and configured two home labs with Domain Controllers and connected VMs to simulate enterprise environments. Focused on AD security and exploitation.

title: Diverse Virtual Machine Lab Environments (20+)
motivation: To simulate realistic enterprise environments for penetration testing and defense.
details: Built and configured over 20 virtual machines (Linux & Windows) using VirtualBox. Configured NAT networks to simulate internal infrastructure for testing and analysis.

title: Splunk Challenge – Boss of the SOC (BOTS) v1
motivation: To gain hands-on experience in SIEM operations and security investigations.
details: Participated in the BOTS v1 challenge by Splunk. Investigated security events in a live Splunk instance, solving log-based analysis tasks and performing incident investigations under time pressure.

title: Blue Team Challenges
motivation: To strengthen detection and investigation skills using real-world datasets.
details: Completed dozens of challenges on Hack The Box and TryHackMe, involving packet capture, memory forensics, malware triage, and threat hunting. Used tools like Wireshark, Sysmon, Volatility, KAPE, and Redline, and applied the MITRE ATT&CK framework.

title: Red Team Challenges
motivation: To sharpen offensive security skills through real-world simulations.
details: Completed numerous challenges covering reconnaissance, exploitation, and post-exploitation. Used tools like Nmap, Metasploit, Burp Suite, Hydra, Mimikatz, Gobuster, and SQLMap for offensive operations.
